title: Daily Telescope: A view of our star as Earth reaches perihelion
summary: There is a bit of irony for those of us who live in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: National Labor Relations Board issues complaint over SpaceX employee firings
summary: The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) is proceeding with a complaint against SpaceX by eight former employees who allege they were illegally fired for circulating an open letter within the company.

title: Maxar wins contract to provide 3D imagery of Indo-Pacific region
summary: Maxar Technologies announced Jan. 4 it secured a contract from the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) to provide advanced satellite imagery and data for 3D maps and models.

title: SpaceX launches Ovzon’s debut broadband satellite
summary: Swedish satcom service provider Ovzon’s first fully owned satellite lifted off on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket Jan. 3, closing a chapter on years of launch and manufacturing setbacks for the broadband spacecraft.

title: Progress Made at SaxaVord, but Questions Remain
summary:
Last month, the UK’s Civil Aviation Authority awarded a spaceport license to SaxaVord, granting it permission to perform 30 launches per year from Unst, a small island off the Northern coast of Scotland. Construction of the spaceport is, however, yet to be completed. While SaxaVord and its management team made a victory lap towards the […]

title: Bumpy Road Ahead for the Remainder of the 118th Congress
summary: The second session of the 118th Congress officially began today at noon although both chambers met only in pro forma sessions. They return for legislative business next week with an […]

title: Ingenuity lessons being incorporated into Mars Sample Return
summary: As a Mars helicopter continues to operate far past expectations, lessons from that vehicle are being incorporated into NASA’s evolving Mars Sample Return plans.

title: ULA Ready for Inaugural Vulcan Flight
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) is preparing for the inaugural flight of its new Vulcan rocket from Space Launch Complex (SLC) 41 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. Liftoff is currently scheduled for Jan. 8, 2023, at 2:18 AM EST (07:18 UTC).

title: More Than Just LEO: A Framework for SPD-8 and Space Critical Infrastructure
summary: The current debate over whether to weight space critical infrastructure on its impact on terrestrial activity overlooks most deep space activity.

title: SUAS Aerospace Aims to Launch Orbital Flights from Ireland
summary:
Irish startup SUAS Aerospace was founded in 2022 with the aim of building a launch facility in Ireland capable of supporting both suborbital and orbital flights. The company has projected that it will conduct its first orbital launch between 2024 and 2025. SUAS Aerospace is headquartered at the Elfordstown Earthstation in Cork, which is owned […]
